title: Typical Mind and Disbelief In Straight People
summary:
Key ideas
- The post discusses how people mistake their own unique ways of experiencing the world for human universals
- The Principle of Charity says you should assume your ideological opponents' beliefs make sense from their perspective
- Opposing homosexuality has never made sense to the author

Key learnings
- Closeted gay individuals who don't realize they are gay might think that the natural state of human males is to be attracted to other men
- Anti-gay positions make sense for someone who doesn't realize they are gay because everyone else is resisting their unbearable homosexual impulses

Key questions
- How can we reconcile the Principle of Charity with beliefs that we find morally abhorrent?
- What is the impact of idiosyncratic arguments that turn into sound bites and justifications for larger groups of people? 
- How can we bridge the gap between our own unique experiences and understanding of the world and the experiences of others?
